Package assemAssist.constraint

Class Inspector

java.lang.Object
assemAssist.constraint.Inspector
public class Inspector extends Object
Class representing a constraint inspector that inspects a car model for being valid according to all the constraints.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Inspector(CarModel carModel)
    Creates a new inspector with the given car model.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inspector

      public Inspector(CarModel carModel) throws IllegalConstraintException, IllegalModelException
      Creates a new inspector with the given car model.
      Parameters:
      carModel - The car model to be inspected.
      Throws:
      IllegalModelException - thrown if the car model is null.
      IllegalConstraintException

  • Method Details

    • inspect

      public void inspect() throws IllegalConstraintException, IllegalModelException, OptionThenComponentException, OptionAThenOptionBException, RequiredComponentException
      Inspects the car model for constraints.
      Throws:
      IllegalConstraintException - thrown if: - a constraint is malformed
      IllegalModelException - thrown if: - the car model is not in the list of car models
      OptionAThenOptionBException - thrown if: - an option implies another option that is not in the list of options
      OptionThenComponentException - thrown if: - an option implies a component that is not in the list of components
      RequiredComponentException - thrown if: - a component is required but not in the list of components

    • addOptionAThenOptionBPair

      public void addOptionAThenOptionBPair(ArrayList<String> pair) throws IllegalConstraintException
      Function that accepts a list of options strings, so that the first element implies one of the latter elements. For example, if the first element is "Green", and the two other elements "V6" and "V8", then Green implies V6 or V8.
      Parameters:
      pair - The list of options that are implied by the first element in the list.
      Throws:
      IllegalConstraintException - thrown if: - the list has less than 2 elements - One of the strings is null - Some strings are duplicated - The list is already in the list of constraints

    • addOptionThenComponentPair

      public void addOptionThenComponentPair(ArrayList<String> pair) throws IllegalConstraintException
      Function that accepts a list of 1 option string followed by 1 component string, so that the first element implies the second element. For example, if the first element is "Green", and the second element is "wheels", then a Green color implies that the car has wheels.
      Parameters:
      pair - A list of 1 option string followed by 1 component string
      Throws:
      IllegalConstraintException - thrown if: - the list doesn't have 2 elements - One of the strings is null - Some strings are duplicated - The list is already in the list of constraints

    • addOptionAAndOptionBPair

      public void addOptionAAndOptionBPair(ArrayList<String> pair) throws IllegalConstraintException
      Function that accepts a list of 1 option string followed by 1 option string, so that the first element implies the second element and vice versa. For example, if the first element is "sedan", and the second element is "Green", then a sedan body implies a Green color and vice versa.
      Parameters:
      pair - A list of two option strings
      Throws:
      IllegalConstraintException - thrown if: - the list doesn't have 2 elements - One of the strings is null - Some strings are duplicated - The list is already in the list of constraints

    • reset

      public static void reset() throws IllegalConstraintException
      Function that clears the list of constraints.
      Throws:
      IllegalConstraintException
